alert.note: Alert for Rutherford; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 6:27PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Rutherford and east central Williamson Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 627 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Nolensville, or 12 miles west of Murfreesboro, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Smyrna, La Vergne, Nolensville and Triune. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 between mile markers 67 and 74. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
